meanings.definition: To make a knurled pattern on (a surface)
meanings.sent1: He nurled the handle of the tool for better grip.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman carefully nurled the edges of the metal piece.
meanings.sent3: The artist nurled the clay into intricate designs, creating a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers nurled the yarn into a beautiful pattern as she knitted.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor nurled the wood with precision, adding texture to the sculpture.

meanings.sent1: The nurled surface of the handle provided a secure grip.
meanings.sent2: The nut had a nurled edge for easy tightening by hand.
meanings.sent3: The nurled texture of the fabric gave it a unique feel.
meanings.sent4: The nurled design on the surface added a touch of elegance to the product.
meanings.sent5: The nurled handle of the cane prevented it from slipping out of his grasp.
